title: Piet Veldsman
text:
Pieter Eden Veldsman (born 11 March 1952) is a former South African <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player.
Playing career.
In 1969 and during his final year at school, Veldsman was selected to represent the <a href="Western%20Province%20%28rugby%20team%29">Western Province</a> schools team at the annual <a href="Craven%20Week">Craven Week</a> tournament that was held in <a href="Pietermaritzburg">Pietermaritzburg</a>. During the early seventies Veldsman played for the Western Province under–20 side and he made his senior provincial debut for Western Province in 1976. 
Veldsman made his <a href="Test%20match%20%28rugby%20union%29">test match</a> debut, which was also his only test for the <a href="Springboks">Springboks</a>, on 27 August 1977 against the <a href="World%20XV">World XV</a> team at <a href="Loftus%20Versfeld%20Stadium">Loftus Versfeld</a> in <a href="Pretoria">Pretoria</a>. Along with Veldsman, there were seven other debutants in the 1977 test match, of whom five also played in only one test match for the Springboks.
